___name.description: The name and url path to use for the site. e.g. "myawesomesite.org/master"

___branch.description: The branch to use for the site. e.g. "master"

___publish_path.description: The path where the project is published locally e.g. "/var/www/myawesomesite.org/site"

___build.description: The generator system to use. "jekyll" or "hugo" or "copy"

___repository.description: The git repository for the site e.g. "https://github.com/ffalt/myawesomesite.git"

___build_path.description: The path where the project is build locally e.g. "./data/myawesomesite.org/build"

___hugo.description: If building with hugo you must define a version

___extended.description: Download extended version of hugo e.g. true

___env.description: Environment settings applied while building the site e.g. {"JEKYLL_ENV": "production"}

___$schema.description: The schema file for the config.json e.g. "config-schema.json"

___version.description: The version of the config file format, must be 2 at the moment

___port.description: The port to listen on. e.g. 8181

___host.description: The address to listen on. e.g. "127.0.0.1" or "0.0.0.0"

___path.description: The url path to listen for hooks on. e.g. "/hooks/*"

___secret.description: The secret token to validate a hook call (https://developer.github.com/webhooks/securing/)
